highlights.para: This chapter describes how to use the Accessibility preference tools to customize your desktop in the following sections:

sect1.title: Configuring Keyboard and Mouse Usage With AccessX
sect1.para: The AccessX application enables you to configure the use of the keyboard and how the mouse pointer moves on-screen. Any changes you make with AccessX take effect immediately.

sect2.title: Opening AccessX
sect2.para: You can open AccessX in the following ways:

listitem.para: From the Menu Panel, choose Applications Desktop Preferences AccessibilityAccessX.

Double-click on the Start Here object on the desktop background. The Start Here location is displayed. Double-click on the Preferences object in the Nautilus window, then double-click on the Accessibility folder. The following figure shows the Accessibility folder:

sect2.para: Double-click on the AccessX object to display the AccessX dialog.
The AccessX dialog Keyboard Accessibility Preferences displays.

sect2.title: Configuring Keyboard Options
sect2.para: Use the Keyboard Accessibility Preferences to configure your keyboard and mouse preferences.
lists the settings you can modify for the keyboard and mouse.

entry.para: Select this option to activate the keyboard preferences. You can specify the following keyboard accessibility parameters:

listitem.para: Beep on state change: Select this option for an audible indication when the state of a session changes.
Disable if unused for x seconds: Select this option to activate the session timeout, and specify the period of time that must pass before timeout occurs. Setting range: 10 to 500 seconds.

entry.para: Select this option to make the numeric keypad on your keyboard emulate mouse actions. You can specify the following mouse key parameters:

listitem.para: Maximum pointer speed: Use this setting to specify the maximum speed that the pointer can move across the screen. Setting range: 1 to 100 pixels per second.
Time to accelerate to maximum speed: Use this setting to specify the duration of the acceleration time of the pointer. Setting range: 10 to 5000 milliseconds.
Start moving this long after keypress: Use this option to specify the period of time that must pass after a keypress before the pointer moves. Setting range: 10 to 5000 milliseconds.

entry.para: Select this option to to accept a key input and to control the key repeating characteristics of the keyboard. You can specify the following bounce keys parameters:

listitem.para: Ignore keypresses within: Use this setting to specify the period of time to wait after the first keypress before automatically repeating a pressed key. Setting range: 10 to 900 milliseconds.
Beep when key is rejected: Select this option for an audible indication of key rejection.

entry.para: You can specify the following toggle keys and repeat keys parameter:
Beep when toggle key is pressed: Select this option for an audible indication of a keypress.
Click on this button to configure your repeat key preferences.
Select this option to control the period of time that you must press and hold a key before acceptance. You can specify the following slow keys parameters:

listitem.para: Only accept keypress after: Use this option to specify the period of time that you must press and hold a key before acceptance. Setting range: 10 and 900 milliseconds.
Beep when key is pressed: Select this option for an audible indication of a keypress.
Beep when key is accepted: Select this option for an audible indication of key acceptance.
Beep when key is rejected: Select this option for an audible indication of key rejection.

entry.para: Select this option to perform multiple simultaneous key press operations by pressing the keys in sequence. You can specify the following sticky keys parameters:

listitem.para: Beep when modifier is pressed: Select this option for an audible indication of a modifier keypress.

Turn off Sticky Keys when two pressed simultaneously: Select this option to specify that when two keys are pressed simultaneously, you can no longer perform multiple simultaneous key press operations by pressing the keys in sequence.

entry.para: The testing area is an interactive interface so you can see how the keyboard settings effect the display as you type. Type text in the Testing Area dialog to test the effect of your settings and view the results.
Click on this button to import an existing AccessX file.
